headline: Parmesan Garlic Bread
description: Butter and Italian-style spices are blended with Parmesan cheese to make a great spread for warm slices of French bread.
name: Parmesan Garlic Bread
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 pound) loaf French bread, halved lengthwise

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
In a small bowl, mix butter, garlic salt, rosemary, basil, thyme, garlic powder and Parmesan cheese.
Spread each half of the French bread with equal portions of the butter mixture. Sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese, if desired.
Place bread halves, crusts down, on a medium baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven 10 to 12 minutes, or until the edges are very lightly browned.

review.reviewBody: Too much garlic salt. Rosemary was overpowering.
Very yummy
Very tasty. Should have made 2 loaves. 1 was not near enough for 5. Making 2 today.

This was a huge hit at the pasta party. I took another reviewer's advice and did 3/4 tsp garlic powder and 1/2 tsp garlic salt. Also I put the 2 halves back together and baked it as my family likes the crispy outside but soft inside
Made it just as the recipe described. I didn't feel it was getting brown enough, so I put it under the broiler for about 90 seconds. It was a bit salty, but otherwise really good.
its ok i guess, i think that it'd be better if there was more garlic powder and also put garlic as a garnish for more flavor!

THIS BREAD WAS AN EXCELLENT ADDITION TO MY DINNER

INSTEAD OF THE HERBS, I ADDED 1 TBL OF ITALIAN SEASONING, 1 TBL OF OLIVE OIL, AND 2 TBL OF PARMASAN CHEESE AND THE FOLLED THE REST OF THE RECIPIE. WILL SEND PHOTO WHEN I MAKE IT NEXT TIME.

I substituted olive oil for the butter because my girl friend cannot have butter. I also added some minced garlic. I made the mixture and refrigerated it. It coagulated and spread like butter on the bread. The bread was delicious.
Amazing flavors. Wouldn't change a thing about this recipe. Lots of compliments from my customers.
This garlic bread was dynamite! Thanks for posting!
You’ve out done yourself this time!!! So says my wife..
I love it, so easy to prepare!!
I used challah instead and it came out great!

I made this tonight like the recipe except that I did 1/4 t instead of where you were supposed to do an 1/8 t and I did 1t of garlic with parsley and a 1/4t of garlic salt. After that I put a 5 cheese Italian blend and cook the bread at 375 for 10 minuets. Everyone loved it and it got devoured quickly! Thanks for the recipe!

I've made this exactly as directed and it's great. If you like to make garlic bread with softened butter on hot dog buns, then that's great too, and you should add your recipe instead of rewriting somebody else's in a comment.
This was very good, I doubled the garlic powder and omitted the garlic salt. It makes a lot and I had some leftover so the next night I melted it on top of some little boiled potatoes. Delicious!
Fantastic, it is a family favorite!
Best Garlic bread I have tried so far. Family had me make it again the next night!
I used the Italian herbs mix instead of the basil etc.

The recipe was a little salty but it still was very easy to make and tasty. I would just go light on the garlic salt just a tad. Other than that great recipe. Also i used Texas tots bread instead of French bread so that could’ve been the reason why. So if you use Texas toast bread just go light on the garlic salt
I used french country bread and it was AH-MAZING!! It took 12 minutes to cook, and then I broiled it for 2 min...I got SO. MANY. COMPLIMENTS. Will definitely make it again.
LOVED this recipe! Great flavors and will be a go to every time. Thanks so much!
I made this, but skipped the garlic & added oregano. So that made it more like a Parmesan herb bread. Delicious & easy! Thanks Sarah!
Fantastic! Will definitely make it again
I would leave the garlic salt out next time.
I’m Italian so I’m hard to impress with food. This garlic bread recipe turned out to be the BEST garlic bread I’ve ever had!!!! Will make every time from now on.
Quick, easy and tasty

only rating this a one star because made this exactly as written there was so much salt in the recipie it could not be eaten, i will try again completely omitting the garlic salt and doubling the garlic powder..
Great recipe I use fresh garlic and some salt instead of powdered.

This bread was delicious! I soften unsalted butter as others suggested (room temp or heat it in the microwave for a few seconds). I also omitted the garlic salt, using only garlic powder. I eyeballed the herbs, used freshly grated parm and added grated pecorino romano to the butter. Spread the mixture on fresh Italian bread, and heated in the oven on 350F until toasted. YUM! I served it along with the "World's Best Lasagne" recipe on this site. Next time I'll try using minced garlic instead of garlic powder.
This is delicious and I always have extra in the fridge for back up.
So easy...So good!! Will use this recipe when making Garlic Bread!

Delicious! Looking at the ingredient list I was a little concerned about the salt intake with this recipe, so removed the garlic salt and replaced it with minced garlic and extra garlic powder. Topped this with mozzarella and served alongside risotto. It went down a treat.

Not crazy about this one. Used unsalted butter but it was still too salty so I threw in another half stick of butter. Too plain so dumped a lot of parm in. Still too plain so added mozzarella under the broiler. Still not that good. Even though it's more work I'm going back to Roasted Garlic Bread on this site. That one is soooo much better. Nothing beats real garlic.

I rarely use salted butter but I did for this and left the garlic salt out. Added Smoked Paprika and minced 1 clove of garlic and grated real Parmesan Cheese Into it. Mixed it all up and let chill for a good 3 hours so everything would get happy. Yummie!!

This was one of the best garlic bread dishes I've ever made! It was easy, but incredibly tasty and I would definitely make it again. I had my favorite garlic bread recipe, but now, I have a new favorite. This.
This recipe was absolutely amazing. It is easy, simple, and the result was a crispy, flavorful garlic bread. I no longer have to buy garlic bread, I can just make it!

Delicious! Easy and fun way to add some variety to your bread! :) Also easy to customize to your own tastes. I made it according to the recipe this time (and it was great!), but might omit the Rosemary next time or make some other changes. Great, basic recipe!

Thank you Sarah, this is delightful. I love the herbs, takes the Garlic Bread up several notches. Two things of note, if you use unsalted butter the garlic salt can still be used. Be aware that not all garlic salts are equal - some are saltier than others. My preference is to use salted butter and no garlic salt at all - just increase the garlic powder to taste. Like other reviewers I only softened the butter, much easier to spread. Although I have also melted the butter and added minced fresh garlic to it. This actually worked very well. Use a pastry brush to get it on the bread.

I gave this 4 stars following the recipe as provided, very good. The second time I made it, I brushed some of the mixture on the bottom and topped the bread with mozzarella cheese. Great recipe. Thanks for sharing.

This is amazing garlic bread! I actually did away with the garlic salt and garlic powder and used actual garlic instead. Plus, I left off the parmesan (by accident) and it tasted fantastic! I don't even bother with the parmesan now because it tastes so good without it, though it could be a nice variation to try in the future.
Very good. Will make this one again.
Much to salty for my taste. Next time, I will cut the garlic salt in half.

This bread is easy and so delicious. I did not melt the butter. I used fresh garlic minced. I prefer to cut bread in one inch slices and butter each side. I turn them over after first side is browned and crispy so the other side is toasted as well. I usually make just 4 slices at a time but I make all the spread. It keeps well in the refrigerator and is available when I want to make more
Too salty, will convert some of the garlic salt to garlic powder next time, and may use unsalted butter. Definitely soften butter instead of melting.
Easy to prepare. I agree with others - omit the garlic salt and maybe just add some more garlic powder to taste.

I thought the recipe was great! Like others said, I softened the butter instead of fully melting it. It spreads better that way. And I will use a bit less garlic salt and a bit more garlic powder as it was a tad too salty. But not TOO salty that it couldn't be eaten ~ every last piece was finished by my crew! :)

This will be my go-to recipe from now on. Just the right amount of herbs and cheese. I did use all garlic powder and the "powdered" parmesan from the green can as I had to take it to a pot luck. It was a good decision, but I would use the fresh grated kind as personal preference.
Yummy! Thanks for sharing!
Great cheesy bread to serve with your favorite pasta! I was out of Rosemary so substituted an Italian seasoning for the Rosemary, thyme, and basil. Still turned out great!

This is my go to garlic bread. I use all garlic powder instead of garlic salt, and I usually just stick the bread under the broiler for a couple minutes instead of baking it. I often make it with sliced Italian bread instead of French bread.

My husband quadrupled this recipe to make for a catered party, to be served with taco soup and a salad. It was so easy and yummy. We had lots of compliments on it. It sure beats buying an expensive bottle of the spice mixture, as you know what is in this one! He made the recipe as written. We didn't think it was too salty.

I made this with English Muffins, omitted the rosemary as I didn't have it. Topped with mozz. cheese. It was AMAZING! (Actually, I didn't have any garlic powder or garlic salt, so I used frozen garlic in the melted butter mixture)

5-Stars with tweaks (yeah, yeah, I know people hate that...). I used real garlic (2 cloves through a press) and omitted the rosemary. With the Parmesan, it doesn't need salt, garlic or otherwise. I agree that the butter does NOT need to be melted, just a little softened.

Fixed 'as is' is totally awesome. All the ingredients, except French bread, are usually in everyone's pantry. A very good recipe to use on the spur of the moment when garlic bread is a must. I used just a pinch of garlic salt but that is just a personal preference. Made with French bread or with sandwich bread of your choice, this is a recipe to keep on hand and give to company when they rave about it. And they will. Thanks for sharing.
Tastes awesome

Used powder instead of salt because I season my pasta sauce and didn't want it too salty. I suggest using Italian seasoning because you add all to taste and its already mixed so well! Other than that the recipe was great!!
liked the blend of spices however will not use garlic salt next time. Way too salty
Yummy!

Oh how I wish I had read the reviews before I made this!! It would have been a 5 star recipe except it was so darn salty! Next time I would either use unsalted butter or swap out at least half the garlic salt for plain garlic powder. Other than the saltiness though, the flavors of this bread were really good.

I looked up this recipe as a last minute thing, so was forced to use what I had on hand. I don't buy garlic salt, so I used garlic powder. My dried rosemary is like dried twigs, I need to see if they sell it in a more ground up form. I tried smooshing it with my fingers, which only broke them in half maybe. I'd like them more finely ground, but I liked the flavor. I happened to have a completely softened stick of butter on the counter, so I used that. At the last minute I realized it was my husband's no salt butter (I use salted butter for everything, he uses his own for buttering toast and such). So I did add salt to this mixture, but I don't think it was enough. Maybe had I used salted butter AND garlic salt, it would have had more flavor. I didn't melt the butter, didn't think it was necessary. I just mixed it all together and buttered slices of whole grain sandwich bread. I put it under the broiler until it was browned. It takes a thick layer of this butter mixture to make it moist and not too dry. I also want to try leaving out the cheese the next time. I don't think it really adds anything special, and have a feeling it just dries it out as well.

I have used this basic recipe but spiced it up with some prosciutto and parsley instead of the rosemary. I also used half the amount of garlic salt and used more garlic powder instead. The butter should be softened, but not melted, it spreads much easier that way. If your family likes "meat and cheese" then this recipe with the addition of the prosciutto will make them very happy!

I was so pleasantly surprised by this recipe. I thought it was going to be your standard "herbed butter", but it was so much better! The addition of parmesan cheese (I used freshly grated) really punches up the flavor. I did tweak it slightly, based on what I had on hand. I didn't have any rosemary or garlic salt, so I substituted oregano and just used a total of 1 1/2 Tbls. garlic powder. Oh, and I didn't melt the butter, I just softened it and mixed everything in with a fork. This is now my new "go to" toasted garlic bread recipe!!

Made this along with some lasagna and it was sooo good. Now i don't have to buy garlic bread from the store, i just make my own spread and i think it taste far better. Thanks so much for this recipe Sarah

I absolutely adore this recipe. I happened to make a few alterations because i didn't have garlic salt on hand, i completely omitted it from the recipe. My family loves garlic so i'm pretty sure i used double if not more garlic powder and i also added about 2 tablespoons of freshly minced garlic. The rosemary has such a great flavor. It almost tasted like the spiced oil you would get to dip your bread in at an Italian restaurant. This recipe is definitely worth making over and over agin. Thank you for sharing:]
The most amazing garlic bread ever! I will never go to a restaurant again for their bread.

This was awesome. I softened the butter and used real parmesan cheese. I pre-slice the bread (but not all the way through) and put the mixture inbetween each slice. I then wrapped it in foil and baked it. Everyone loved it!!
LOVE THIS BREAD. My picky family loves when I make this bread.

I used homemade butter I had in the freezer and didn't bother to melt it. Just stirred in the garlic salt, Parmesan and a Tuscan seasoning blend similar to the indivual herbs called for. I used good, crusty rolls, which I simply placed on a cookie sheet and threw under the broiler for a few minutes. Easy, quick, VERY flavorful, crispy, and pretty!

I tried this recipe tonight as a spur of the moment side for our spaghetti, in place of my bland bread, butter, and garlic dish I just throw together. This was a hit and it was so simple! My family very much enjoyed this. As always, I followed the recipe exactly.
Delicious! As others have noted, if you're using salted butter you can just cut out the other salt altogether.
Excellent!! I ate more of this bread than I needed to. YUM :)
This is so easy and so tasty! I didn't have French bread so used .... drumroll please .... hot dog buns! Nobody noticed and they were devoured in no time flat!
A little less garlic salt and a little less butter would be better.

Really good, quick and easy. I never use garlic salt. Just use garlic powder and add salt to taste (you may not even need any salt if using salted butter). I used the parmesan cheese from the green can because that's all I had, and it was delicious.
We won't make garlic bread any other way - this was so very yummy!!
Followed this recipe to the T. AMAZING!

A nice, quick bread for those evenings when you're in a rush to get dinner on the table. I would omit the garlic salt and use all garlic powder, and I wouldn't bother melting the butter either, as other reviewers have mentioned. I do love the addition of herbs to this garlic bread; I thought the thyme was especially good in this recipe. Thanks for sharing!
Absolutely the best garlic bread recipe I have ever tasted!!
Love this bread! I never by the frozen stuff anymore.
I really enjoyed this recipe. I did not use the garlic salt rather just regular garlic powder and table salt. The cooking temp was a bit too low and I ended up broiling at the end. Very Good.
I really enjoyed this recipe. I did not use the garlic salt rather just regular garlic powder and table salt. The cooking temp was a bit too low and I ended up broiling at the end. Very Good.
This was pretty good but it was waaaay too salty. Next time I will skip the garlic salt and add more garlic powder.
FANTASTIC!!!
Was a nice yummy bread to go with pasta. A bit heavy but good none the less.
This is a good basic recipe for garlic bread. The overall flavour was very enjoyable although the garlic was not as pronounced as we would have preferred.

Two stars as written, four by the time I was done with it. I mixed the spices/parmesan cheese with room temperature butter (to make a spread). I took a taste after mixing it and and thought it tasted a whole lot like regular butter. Not nearly enough seasoning for me! I added a tablespoon of italian seasoning, a teaspoon of crushed dried rosemary, and a 1/4 cup of parmesan. Now we were on to something. I spread the mixture on fresh french bread, and baked it at 350 until it reached the desired crispness. It turned out more than great.
Best Garlic Bread EVER! will make this over and over again!
Loved it! Everyone in the family just cant get enough of it. I even tried it with wheat bread, turned out to be amazing.

This is my new go-to recipe for garlic bread! Made it twice this week!!! I change the serving size to 2 (just me and my husband) and it makes the perfect amound for 4 pieces of whatever type of nice bread we have in the kitchen.

Delicious! The only adjustments I made were: I omitted the garlic salt, and added about 1 tsp. of freshly chopped garlic. I also cooked the bread for a few minutes longer than the recipe calls for, and I added some more shredded parmesan on top for the last few minutes of baking. It was wonderful! I will be making this again!!

Altho the directions are conflicting(use "melted butter" but you're supposed to "spread" that on the bread??) & the baking temp turned the top of my bread hard well before the buttered side had a chance to even heat up, I'm going to rate this a 4. My boys thought this was the best garlic bread they've ever eaten!! I'm not a fan of rosemary but thought it was very good also. After the 10 min in the oven at 300, I pulled the bread out & cranked it up to 450 to "toast" the buttered side.
Loved it! I left out the garlic salt and doubled the garlic powder. This one is a keeper! Thanks for the recipe.

awesome! looking for an alternative to the nasty preservative filled frozen options, I stumbled upon this recipe. I only use 1/2 stick of butter, lots of parmesan, much less garlic salt, then some garlic powder, basil, oregano & italian seasoning. baked at 350 along with baked spaghetti and it was perfect after 10 mins. gave 4 stars because the garlic salt as written was way too salty at my first attempt.
My picky family loved it

I cut this recipe in half, used garlic powder instead of garlic salt and I used sandwich bread that needed to be used up. (Ghetto? Sure. But it works just as any other bread would.) Family thought this was very tasty. I did not have any, I just looked at it with longing.
YUMMY!

Tasty! After reading reviews, I skipped the garlic powder and even with being a salt enthusiast, I found the bread just a smidge too salty. I had neither rosemary nor basil, so, I improvised with "Pampered Chef: Italian Seasoning Mix" (onion, garlic, oregano, basil, marjoram). Like others suggested, I softened the butter instead of melting and then mixed-in the spices, providing a nice spreadable mixture.
pretty good, added sliced chicken and beef
